report_title: Data Center Colocation Services Industry Report
executive_summary: Operators of data center colocation services enjoyed strong demand for rental of equipment, space and bandwidth for companies to store servers. Over the past five years, operators have benefited from strong growth as digitalization continues to take hold. Increases in the percentage of business conducted online and the number of mobile internet connections have directly contributed to demand for colocation services; as companies increasingly digitize their operations and as demand for bandwidth-intensive services grows, more data storage is required.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Notable Impact of COVID-19 Significantly Accelerates Operator Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Since data center colocation services benefit from higher internet traffic and a larger array of usage among customers, operators wound up benefiting during COVID-19, as more downstream customers required a higher amount of bandwidth to store data.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Operators have benefited from growing demand for hyperscale data centers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Operators have benefited from growing demand for hyperscale data centers, which are defined as data centers that exceed 5,000 servers and 10,000 square feet.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Revenue is expected to continue growing over the next five years
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Revenue is expected to continue growing over the next five years, albeit at a slower pace.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Continued Growth of Mobile Phone Usage Expands Need for Larger Data Storage
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A core development that has helped operators in recent years is the consistent proliferation of mobile phone and smartphone technology in the hands of consumers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growing Intensity of Digital Tasks Creates Higher Demand for Hyperscale Data Centers
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Operators have continued to leverage favorable developments in the technological space by setting up hyperscale data centers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Favorable Trends in the Cost of Technological Equipment Benefit Operators
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Since data colocation services require significant energy to supply power, the falling costs of core inputs necessary to produce such facilities bodes well for operators and boosts their rate of revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Reopening of the Economy Will Curtail Large-Scale Demand for Operators' Services
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: With economic conditions recovering following COVID-19 and many large-scale sectors of the American economy reopening to pre-pandemic capacity, it will dampen data and server storage needs for operators.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry provide rental services of data centers, including equipment, space and bandwidth to customers.
key_trends: Sharp rise in technological adoption enhances operator performance.
Higher rates of mobile phone and computer usage

market_segmentation.segment_description: This market segment generates revenue among IT and cloud companies.

This market segment generates revenue among healthcare clients.

products_and_services.product_or_service: High Inflation Eats Into Demand Among Retail Customers
products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue from retail colocation spaces.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Greater Quantity of Data Storage Enhances Popularity of Wholesalers
products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue from wholesale colocation spaces.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Cost-Effectiveness Improves Popularity of Hybrid Colocation Services
products_and_services.product_description: This product segment generates revenue from hybrid cloud-based colocation services.

business_locations.location: ROBUST POPULATION PRESENCE ENHANCES ESTABLISHMENT GROWTH IN THE SOUTHEAST
business_locations.location_description: Data center colocation service operators favor regions with a large saturation of customers.

business_locations.location: LARGE PRESENCE OF TECHNOLOGICAL COMPANIES BOOSTS ESTABLISHMENT GROWTH IN THE WEST
business_locations.location_description: A significant saturation of large media, internet and digital industries creates a robust demand niche.

business_locations.location: BOOMING MANUFACTURING MARKET CREATES UNIQUE DEMAND NICHE IN THE GREAT LAKES
business_locations.location_description: Most establishment demand is generated by a consistently growing manufacturing base.

business_locations.location: HEAVY CORPORATE PRESENCE ENHANCES ESTABLISHMENT GROWTH IN THE MID-ATLANTIC
business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region creates a favorable market for operators.

business_locations.location: GROWING SUBURBAN PRESENCE CREATES NEW DEMAND FOR DATA COLOCATION SERVICES IN THE SOUTHWEST
business_locations.location_description: Although the Southwest lacks the population centers, it does house a growing number of small business clients.

regulations_points.regulation_description: To ensure safety and security of clients' data.

basis_points.basis_description: Operators that offer efficient storage and security.

basis_points.basis_title: Expansion of data storage by tech companies exacerbates external competition
basis_points.basis_description: As more prominent companies invest in data centers in-house.

concentration_points.concentration_title: High operational costs limit expansion opportunities
concentration_points.concentration_description: Data center colocation services face significant operational costs that hinder large-scale expansion.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Popularity of data storage creates robust opportunities for new operators
concentration_points.concentration_description: As more businesses adopt higher bandwidth devices, it creates larger needs for hyperscale data centers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Large Maintenance Costs Heighten Administrative Expenses
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, all other costs are expected to account for 44.2% of revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Emphasis on Customer Service Enhances Wage Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, wage costs are expected to account for 33.0% of revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: High Inflation Impacts Equipment Procurement Costs
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, purchase costs are expected to account for 8.1% of revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Steady Growth in Competition Negatively Influences Profit
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In 2023, profit is expected to account for 8.0% of revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry is primarily labor-intensive due to the need for qualified staff.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low rate of new patent additions and low concentration of innovation
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The rate of new patent additions to the industry is low.
The major markets are highly concentrated, focusing on key customer segments.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Stabilization of Economic Conditions Dampens Broader Volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Operators have secured consistent revenue streams from core clients.

volatility_points.volatility_title: New Technology Offers New Opportunities for Future Growth
volatility_points.volatility_description: The large spike in demand during the pandemic heightened the need for robust data storage.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Consistent development of new technology creates uncertainty
volatility_points.volatility_description: Operators must remain vigilant on the latest developments.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment generates revenue from retail colocation spaces.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: GREATER QUANTITY OF DATA STORAGE ENHANCES POPULARITY OF WHOLESALERS
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment generates revenue from wholesale colocation spaces.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: This segment generates revenue from hybrid cloud-based colocation services.

FAQs.question: Has regulatory scrutiny affected how you target customers?
How has the shift towards conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: - Rapid growth in the percentage of services conducted online has been a significant driver of revenue growth.

FAQs.question: How do your depreciation and R&D spending levels compare with your competitors?
FAQs.answer: - Vendors must increase spending on security and infrastructure.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to rising wages in recent years?
Has your company prepared adequately to address the increased security risks posed by digital data storage?
FAQs.answer: Cyber security is one of the most important issues.
